newsitem.title: FRANCE: Suez, Lyonnaise merger terms not set - Monod.
newsitem.headline: Suez, Lyonnaise merger terms not set - Monod.

text.p: Utilities group Lyonnaise des Eaux and holding company Cie de Suez have not fixed any of the terms of a planned merger, Lyonnaise chairman Jerome Monod said on Thursday.
The boards of both companies have unanimously approved the merger in principle and are due to hold special meetings on April 11 to discuss the merger plan.
"The terms have not been fixed in any way whatsoever," Monod told a news conference on his company's 1996 results.
He said a new group created by the planned merger must "be able to guarantee fast growth in well-identified core businesses and increase pre-exceptional profit and cash flow".
